name.en: Special Topics on ERP and Data Warehouse

goal.ch:
"As enterprise worldwide strive for real time management, quick responses from managers become mandate for many enterprises. To help managers make quick responses, however, information has to be ready quickly, too. The technology maturity of ERP systems establishes a foundation for providing the raw data for the responsiveness. However, the data in ERP systems along with data in other systems has to be cleaned, extracted, and loaded to a system that can effectively store the unified data and has user-friendly query tools to produce managerial reports. The system is called Data Warehouse or Business Intelligence. The concept of data warehouse is introduced at 1992 and the capital invested in projects of Data warehouse has over taken ERP projects in north America as the top priority projects. Therefore, learning the related knowledge should help students to prepare their career in the future.
The course is intended to introduce SAP BW, which includes ETL, modeling, and query reporting tools. By practicing on the system, students should be able to get first-hand experience on how to build models, load data and place queries in a data Warehouse environment. Students will need to do small projects based on the system introduced in the class.
The course assumes students have basic understanding of databases or On-Line Transaction Processing systems.
Homework:
Each student should finish two units of homework before midterms
Project:
students are grouped into teams to design a model with multidimensional model and implement the model with SAP BIW and perform OLAP queries."
